title: Development of Integrated Disposition Strategies for Language Instructional Design in Higher Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic instructional design experience in secondary education settings and language education-related job competencies
context.additional_context: Course exploring disposition-integrated approaches applicable to actual lesson design by in-service language teachers. Requires collaboration tools (e.g., Google Workspace) in BYOD environments

learning_goals: Using the Integrated Course Design Framework (Fink, 2013), identify at least three dispositional elements (attitudes/values) suitable for language subjects.
Design two or more real-time online learning activities (e.g., role-playing, reflective journaling) based on learner dispositions.
Develop a rubric or portfolio assessment system to evaluate dispositions, incorporating it into 50% of summative assessment items.

resources: Case Analysis Materials (5 Exemplary Cases of Language Attitude Integration)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
